hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In ${\maroonD{9}} = \purpleC{72} \div \greenD{{?}}$, the $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{72}$.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{9}}$.

![Tape diagram showing 72 is equal to question mark equal groups of 9](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/3e0f243e1c45fc35fe4bc6effaaa508a8d8277f3)

The $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{?}$.

Luca can use these multiplication equations:

- $\purpleC{72} = \greenD{{?}} \times \maroonD{{9}}$
- $\purpleC{72} = \maroonD{9} \times \greenD{{?}}$

question.content:
Luca wants to use multiplication to solve $9 = 72 \div {?}$.

**Which two multiplication equations can Luca use?**
